result.execSummary:
The defendant Shaquille McDonald was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Shaquille McDonald in court with attorney Roger L. Klopp.  Defendant Shaquille McDonald in custody.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives recommedation.  Count 2 amended to 947.01 and Count 3.  Dismiss/read in Count 1.   Attorney Klopp addresses the offer extended.  Now agreed upon.  No contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court finds Defendant guilty.  Attorney Klopp addresses court and sentencing argument.  Court imposes sentence.
Count 2:
$243.00 fine or costs and $200.00 DNA surcharge, 60 days to pay or set up a payment plan.
20 Days in Sauk County Jail, with huber, consecutive.  95 days credit.  TIME SERVED
Submit to DNA sample.  
Count 3:
$243.00 fine or costs and $200.00 DNA surcharge, 60 days to pay or set up a payment plan.
20 Days in Sauk County Jail, with huber, consecutive.
Defendant to be turned over to I.C.E.  
Paperwork handed in court.

Defendant Shaquille McDonald in court with attorney Roger L. Klopp.  Defendant Shaquille McDonald in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Requests plea date.  Plea hearing scheduled for December 4, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Shaquille McDonald in court with attorney Roger L. Klopp.  Defendant Shaquille McDonald in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Just recv'd offer 2 days ago.  Need more time.  Reset.  Bond continues.  Return date scheduled for November 25, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Shaquille McDonald in court with attorney Roger L. Klopp.  Defendant Shaquille McDonald in custody.  Kevin R. Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Klopp requests reset.  Has spoken to ADA Ryan but needs more time.  Bond continued.  Return date scheduled for October 23, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Ryan states case and appearances.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Shaquille McDonald in court with attorney Roger L. Klopp.  Defendant Shaquille McDonald in custody.  Klopp addresses Court; requests that time limits be waived and that the matter be set for a PTC and RD.  Court addresses McDonald; waiver of time limits.  McDonald responds; agrees to waiver to time limits.  Court rules as follows:  Waiver of time limits is freely given.  Matter is set for a PTC and RD.  Bond contiunes.

Defendant Shaquille McDonald appeared by video means from LEC w/atty. Peter Middleton. Prosecuting Atty Sue Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint. DE has not qualify for PD representation but Atty. MIddleton believes DE should qualify.  Advised rights to an attorney.  State requests $25,000 Cash.  Atty. Middleton requests modest cash like $1000.00 and DE here on VISA and on an immigration hold.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits NOT waived.  Court sets $25,000 Cash bond.  Special bond conditions as follows: No contact w/victims AA or JI; Not leave State of WI; Surrender passport over to COC.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 11, 2015 at 11:00 am.
